headline: International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2023
author: NA
content: The 2023 edition of the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) is set to take place in New York City from June 19th to June 23rd. This annual event brings together researchers, practitioners, and enthusiasts from around the world to discuss the latest advancements in machine learning and its applications. Keynote speakers include Dr. Yoshua Bengio, Professor at the University of Montreal, who will deliver a keynote titled 'The Future of AI: Challenges and Opportunities.' Other notable speakers include Dr. Andrew Ng, co-founder of Coursera, and Dr. Fei-Fei Li, director of Stanford's AI Lab. The conference will feature over 150 workshops, tutorials, and special sessions covering various topics such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and more. Attendees can also expect a wide range of research papers and posters showcasing cutting-edge work in the field. Registration for ICML 2023 is now open, with early bird discounts available until April 30th. The conference will be held at the Javits Center in Manhattan, offering easy access to public transportation and a variety of accommodations nearby. For more information, visit the official website at icml.cc.
